member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.EventBroker
member.summary: The is the facade component to the event broker framework. It provides the registration and deregistration functionality for event publisher and subscribers.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventBroker
member.summary: Interface for . Use this interface to reference the event broker from your classes. This gives you the possibility to mock it.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventBroker.DescribeTo(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Describes all event topics of this event broker: publications, subscriptions, names, thread options, scopes, event args.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventBroker.Fire(System.String,System.Object,Appccelerate.EventBroker.HandlerRestriction,System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Fires the specified topic directly on the without a real publisher. This is useful when temporarily created objects need to fire events. The event is fired globally but can be subscribed with .
member.param: The publisher (for event flow and logging).
The sender (passed to the event handler).
The instance containing the event data.

member.summary: Adds the extension.

member.summary: Removes the specified extension.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventBroker.ClearExtensions
member.summary: Clears all extensions, including the default logger extension.

member.summary: Adds the global matcher.

member.summary: Removes the global matcher.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Factories.UnitTestFactory
member.summary: Factory that creates only handlers that run on the same thread as the publisher. This allows that subscriptions on user interface thread can be used in unit tests (with different threading behavior though)

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Factories.UnitTestFactory.CreateHandler(System.Type)
member.summary: Creates a subscription handler usable in unit tests (always on publisher thread).
member.param: Type of the handler to create.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.HandlerKind
member.summary: Defines the way the subscription handler handles events (synchronously or asynchronously).

member.name: F:Appccelerate.EventBroker.HandlerKind.Synchronous
member.summary: Synchronous handling. The event invoker is blocked until event is handled. The event invoker can evaluate the event arguments on return.

member.name: F:Appccelerate.EventBroker.HandlerKind.Asynchronous
member.summary: Asynchronous handling. The event invoker is not blocked until event is handled. The event invoker must not evaluate the event arguments on return.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.HandlerRestriction
member.summary: Defines restrictions the publisher makes on how the event has to be handled (synchronously or asynchronously).

member.name: F:Appccelerate.EventBroker.HandlerRestriction.None
member.summary: Synchronous and asynchronous handling is allowed.

member.name: F:Appccelerate.EventBroker.HandlerRestriction.Synchronous
member.summary: Only synchronous handling is allowed, e.g. the publisher wants to evaluate the event arguments afterwards.

member.name: F:Appccelerate.EventBroker.HandlerRestriction.Asynchronous
member.summary: Only asynchronous handling is allowed. The publisher does not want to be blocked.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Handlers.OnBackground
member.summary: Handler that executes the subscription on a thread pool worker process (asynchronous).

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Handlers.EventBrokerHandlerBase
member.summary: Abstract base class for event broker handles providing the host of extensions.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IHandler
member.summary: A handler defines how a subscription is executed (on which thread, sync, asynchronous, ...).

member.summary: Initializes the handler.
member.param: Name of the handler method on the subscriber.
Provides access to all registered extensions.

member.name: P:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IHandler.Kind
member.summary: Gets the kind of the handler, whether it is a synchronous or asynchronous handler.
member.value: The kind of the handler (synchronous or asynchronous).

member.summary: Initializes the handler.

member.summary: Handles a subscriber method exception by passing it to all extensions and re-throwing the inner exception in case that none of the extensions handled it.

member.summary: Gets the kind of the handler, whether it is a synchronous or asynchronous handler.

member.summary: Gets the kind of the handler, whether it is a synchronous or asynchronous handler.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Handlers.OnPublisher
member.summary: Handler that executes the subscription on the same thread the publisher is currently running (synchronous).

member.name: P:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Handlers.OnPublisher.Kind
member.summary: Gets the kind of the handler, whether it is a synchronous or asynchronous handler.
member.value: The kind of the handler (synchronous or asynchronous).

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Handlers.OnUserInterface
member.summary: Handler that executes the subscription synchronously on the user interface thread (Send semantics).

member.name: F:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Handlers.OnUserInterface.syncContextHolder
member.summary: The synchronization context that is used to switch to the UI thread.

member.summary: Gets the kind of the handler, whether it is a synchronous or asynchronous handler.
member.value: The kind of the handler (synchronous or asynchronous).

member.summary: Handler that executes the subscription asynchronously on the user interface thread (Post semantics).

member.summary: The synchronization context that is used to switch to the UI thread.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventBrokerRegisterable.Unregister(Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventRegistrar)
member.summary: The publisher or subscribe has to clean-up all registrations made in call to .

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventRegistrar
member.summary: This interface is passed to the registered publishers and subscribers so that they can register publications and subscriptions by code.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventTopic
member.summary: Represents a point of communication on a certain topic between the topic publishers and the topic subscribers.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventTopicInfo
member.summary: Represents a point of information on a certain topic between the topic publishers and the topic subscribers.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventTopicInfo.DescribeTo(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Describes this event topic: publications, subscriptions, names, thread options, scopes, event arguments.

member.name: P:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventTopicInfo.Uri
member.summary: Gets the URI for the event topic. This URI is the unique identifier for this event topic.
member.value: The URI of this event topic.

member.name: P:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventTopicInfo.Publications
member.summary: Gets the publications for the event topic.
member.remarks: The publications are frequently cleaned internally when necessary. Therefore the publications are only valid at the time when they are requested and should not be cached or referenced longer then necessary.

member.name: P:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventTopicInfo.Subscriptions
member.summary: Gets the subscriptions for the event topic.
member.remarks: The subscriptions are frequently cleaned internally when necessary. Therefore the subscriptions are only valid at the time when they are requested and should not be cached or referenced longer then necessary.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventTopicHost
member.summary: An event topic hosts is context where publications and subscriptions are wired together through s.
member.remarks: Only publications and subscription in the same host are wired together. You can use several event topic hosts by exchanging them during registration on the .

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.IEventTopicHost.GetEventTopic(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a event topic. Result is never null. Event topic is created if it does not yet exist.
member.param: The topic URI identifying the event topic to return.
member.returns: A non-null event topic. Event topic is created if it does not yet exist.
member.remarks: Returns a non null instance of the dictionary.

member.summary: Describes all event topics: publications, subscriptions, names, thread options, scopes, event arguments.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.IPublicationMatcher
member.summary: Interface for scope matchers on publications. Scope matchers are used to determine whether an event is handled depending on the name of the publisher and subscriber.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.ISubscriptionMatcher
member.summary: Interface for matchers on subscriptions. Matchers are used to determine whether an event is handled depending on the state of the publisher and subscriber.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.NotAlreadyCanceled
member.summary: Subscription matcher that matches only if the event arguments are and the event arguments are not yet canceled.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.NotAlreadyCanceled.Match(Appccelerate.EventBroker.IPublication,Appccelerate.EventBroker.ISubscription,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
Returns whether the publication and subscription match and the event published by the publisher will be relayed to the subscriber.
Matches if the event arguments are that are not yet canceled.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.
member.returns: true if event has to be sent to the subscriber.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.NotAlreadyCanceled.DescribeTo(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Describes this subscription matcher.
member.param: The writer the description is written to.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.Scope.PublishGlobal
member.summary: Matcher for globally published events.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.Scope.PublishGlobal.Match(Appccelerate.EventBroker.IPublication,Appccelerate.EventBroker.ISubscription,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
Returns whether the publication and subscription match and the event published by the publisher will be relayed to the subscriber.
This is the always the case for global publications.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.
member.returns: true if event has to be sent to the subscriber.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.Scope.PublishGlobal.DescribeTo(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Describes this scope matcher.
member.param: The writer the description is written to.

member.name: T:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.Scope.PublishToChildren
member.summary: Matcher for publications to children only.

member.name: M:Appccelerate.EventBroker.Matchers.Scope.PublishToChildren.Match(Appccelerate.EventBroker.IPublication,Appccelerate.EventBroker.ISubscription,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
Returns whether the publication and subscription match and the event published by the publisher will be relayed to the subscriber.
This is the case if the name of the publisher is a prefix to the name of the subscriber.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.
member.returns: true if event has to be sent to the subscriber.
